decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent by using low-cost burn spells and efficient creatures. By using cards like Lightning Bolt, Lava Spike, and Monastery Swiftspear, the goal is to burn through the opponent's life total as quickly as possible. The inclusion of cards like Boros Charm and Eidolon of the Great Revel allow for additional damage output and disruption to the opponent's game plan. This deck aims to end the game swiftly before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by manipulating the board and countering opponent's spells. It utilizes a combination of card draw, counterspells, removal, and board wipes to maintain control of the game. The win condition is through either planeswalker ultimate abilities or attacking with man lands. The deck aims to stall the opponent's threats while setting up its own win conditions. The main strategy is to outvalue the opponent through efficient card advantage and disruption, ultimately grinding out a victory.

The main concept of this Aggro - Hardened Scales deck is to quickly build up a board presence with creatures like Steel Overseer, Arcbound Ravager, and Hangarback Walker while utilizing Hardened Scales to increase the number of +1/+1 counters placed on them. Cards like Walking Ballista and Animation Module also help in creating a threatening board state. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a large number of creatures with enhanced power and toughness, supported by artifact synergy provided by Mox Opal and Throne of Geth.

The main focus of this deck is to assemble the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Urza's Mine, Urza's Power Plant) to generate a large amount of mana, allowing for powerful spells and threats to be played earlier than usual. The deck contains various ways to tutor for the UrzaTron lands, along with powerful colorless threats like Karn Liberated, Wurmcoil Engine, and Eldrazi creatures like Ulamog and Emrakul. Additionally, the deck includes removal spells and board wipes to control the opponent's board while establishing a dominant presence on the battlefield.

The deck focuses on quickly burning through opponents' life totals with efficient burn spells and aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Goblin Guide. It aims to deal damage as quickly as possible, often bypassing opponents' defenses with direct damage spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike. The deck's mana base is streamlined to maximize consistency and allows for flexible casting of spells, ensuring that the pressure is maintained throughout the game. With a mix of direct damage and creature aggression, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents before they can stabilize.

The deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent using low-cost spells and efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Goblin Guide. The goal is to maintain pressure throughout the game with a mixture of burn spells and direct attacks, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Skullcrack and Eidolon of the Great Revel. By efficiently using mana and maximizing damage output, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize or mount a successful defense.

This deck is focused on dealing quick and efficient damage to your opponent using low-cost spells and creatures. The key strategy is to overwhelm your opponent with a fast-paced aggression, utilizing burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike to deal direct damage, while creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear put pressure on the opponent. Eidolon of the Great Revel punishes opponents for casting spells, further disrupting their game plan. The deck aims to close out games quickly before the opponent can stabilize, relying on a mix of burn spells and aggressive creatures to secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the KCI combo (Krark-Clan Ironworks) to generate a large amount of mana and repeatedly sacrifice artifacts to dig through the deck, generate card advantage, and eventually win the game through a combo finish. The deck focuses on utilizing artifacts like Mind Stone, Terrarion, and Mox Opal to generate mana and card advantage, while also using cards like Scrap Trawler and Myr Retriever to recur artifacts from the graveyard and continue the combo. The deck aims to quickly assemble the combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with its powerful engine.

The deck focuses on playing aggressive Spirit creatures and using their abilities to disrupt the opponent's game plan. With cards like Supreme Phantom and Drogskol Captain boosting the spirits' power and toughness, combined with cards like Spell Queller to counter spells and Collected Company to put more creatures on the battlefield quickly, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can set up their own strategy. The deck also has some land cards to fix mana and protect its creatures, making it a versatile and aggressive archetype in Modern format.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent by utilizing efficient and low-cost spells like Lightning Bolt, Lava Spike, and Searing Blaze, while also preventing them from gaining life through cards like Boros Charm and Skullcrack. By playing powerful creatures like Monastery Swiftspear, Goblin Guide, and Eidolon of the Great Revel, the deck aims to establish early board presence and maintain pressure on the opponent, ultimately aiming to overwhelm them with a relentless barrage of burn spells and creature attacks.

The deck focuses on assembling a powerful combo involving Devoted Druid and Vizier of Remedies to generate infinite mana, which can then be used to pump up your creatures with Ezuri, Renegade Leader for a lethal attack. The deck also includes various elf creatures and tribal synergies to help ramp up your board presence and find key combo pieces through cards like Collected Company and Chord of Calling. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with a quick and explosive combo finish while maintaining a strong tribal theme throughout the deck.

The deck focuses on maximizing +1/+1 counters on creatures using cards like Hardened Scales and Steel Overseer, while also utilizing modular and proliferate mechanics. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of buffed creatures, using Evolutionary Leap and Throne of Geth for additional utility. The deck includes mana acceleration with Mox Opal and land cards like Inkmoth Nexus for added versatility. With a mix of creature and artifact synergy, the deck is able to quickly build up a threatening board presence and pressure the opponent to either deal with the creatures or face a swift defeat.

The main concept of this deck is to use fast mana acceleration and efficient pump spells to quickly power up and protect your Infect creatures, such as Glistener Elf and Blighted Agent, and win the game by dealing 10 poison counters to your opponent. The deck aims to assemble a lethal combination of creatures and spells to overwhelm your opponent's defenses and win the game before they can stabilize or mount a defense. It combines speed, protection, and explosive finishers to create a deadly Infect combo strategy.

The deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures like Tarmogoyf and Bloodbraid Elf while controlling the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Abrupt Decay. Liliana of the Veil and Liliana, the Last Hope provide additional disruption while cards like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize help to strip the opponent's hand of threats. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers and land destruction spells to maintain control of the game. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure early and disrupt the opponent's game plan to secure a win.

The main strategy of this deck is to cycle through your cards quickly using cards like Street Wraith and Architects of Will to get your combo pieces in your graveyard. Once you have enough creatures in your graveyard, you can cast Living End to bring them back onto the battlefield, overwhelming your opponent with powerful creatures all at once. Cards like Violent Outburst and Demonic Dread help you cascade into Living End for maximum efficiency. This deck focuses on creating a quick and explosive board state to take your opponent by surprise and secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by assembling the UrzaTron lands to generate a large amount of mana quickly. This allows the player to cast powerful spells such as Karn Liberated, Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger to dominate the board and win the game. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Expedition Map and Sylvan Scrying to help find the UrzaTron lands, while also including removal and graveyard hate like Ancient Grudge and Relic of Progenitus to disrupt the opponent's strategy.
